result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Anissa E Weier was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:36 PM Defendant Anissa E Weier in court with attorneys Joseph Smith and Maura McMahon.  Attorneys Ted Szczupakiewicz and Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court addresses the conditional release plan.  Both parties have reviewed the conditional release plan.  The Court notes that the author of the report Ms. Slawson is in court today.  No questions at this time by either party to Ms. Slawson.  
The Court will release the conditional release plan after the hearing is complete.
Attorney McMahon requests that Ms. Weier's address be redacted from the plan.  The Court orders that Ms. Weier's address be redacted, so ordered.
Attorney Szczupakiewicz requests to modify the plan to include language as to the GPS monitoring language.  Attorney McMahon makes statements as to that being left up to the case manager.
Statements by Attorney Jennifer Dunn.  Questions by the Court as to anything Attorney Dunn might want to include in the report.  Response by Attorney Dunn stating not at this time.
The Court makes statements as to if the GPS requirement is to be modified, the Court will need to be notified 30 days before.  This will be included as an amendment to the plan. 
Attorney McMahon states there is a request from the Department of Corrections to return Ms. Weier to Winnebago Mental Health Institution until Monday to be released from their facility.
Attorney Szczupakiewicz states there is a request to allow the evaluations done previously by the doctors for the conditional release to be released to Waukesha County providers.  
Questions by the Court as to the additional two evaluations of Ms. Weier being released.
Response by Department of Corrections Agent Shannon Stydahar-Schulz requesting the release of the conditional release letters from 3/1/21 and 6/28/21.  No objections by Attorney McMahon.  The Court orders the release of these documents as well as the evaluations from Dr. Rawski, Dr. Collins, and Dr. Westendorf, to be included in the order.
Questions by the Court as to any objections to the modifications of the report.  Response by Attorney McMahon stating no objections.  

The Court finds that the report is fair and reasonable and provides protection for both the community and Ms. Weier.
The Court approves the conditional release plan and authorizes the release of the report.
The Court orders Ms. Weier's address be sealed/redacted, so ordered.
The Court approves the request for the modification of the GPS language and orders the Court be notified 30 days before.
The Court directs Ms. Weier to be returned to Winnebago Mental Health Institution until Monday at which time to be released from their facility.

Defendant Anissa E Weier in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon. Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz and Kevin Osborne appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Opening statements by Attorney Kevin Osborne. State is requesting the maximum amount of institutional care of 25 years and that Ms. Weier take all prescribe mediation.

Court orders Anissa Weier to return to the Waukesha Juvenile Detention till 4:00 pm to meet with her family and Attorneys.

Day 5 of Jury Trial. 

Defendant Anissa E Weier in court, in custody, with attorneys Joseph Smith and Maura Ann Mcmahon. Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz and Kevin Osborne appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to move forward with closing arguments. Jurors enter the courtroom at 8:40 am. Court gives Jury instructions to the Jurors. Defense makes closing arguments. State makes closing arguments. Defense makes additional statements. Court addresses the Jury. Court announces the alternate jurors that will be excused to a different secure location from the presiding 12 jurors.  Civilian Bailiff is sworn in. Jury retires to deliberate at 10:07 am  Both counsel stipulate that should the jurors request the exhibits that they be permitted to see them. 

Court reconvenes at 11:39 am. Same appearances. The Court received a question from the jury at 11:27 am. Court makes a copy of the question for the parties and discusses the question with the parties. Court receives another question from the jurors at 11:54 am. Court makes a copy of that question for the parties and discusses the question with the parties. Court makes a decision to the second question at 12:01 pm. and provides the answer back to the jurors. Court is back to the original question. Court makes a decision on the original question at 12:08 pm. Parties stipulated that the jurors are allowed to view all of exhibit E. Court provides the answer back to the jurors.  Court breaks for a lunch. 

Court reconvenes at 1:11 pm. same appearances without Anissa Weier. Jurors enter the Courtroom.  Court plays exhibit E for the jurors in the courtroom. Court breaks at 2:02 pm. 

Court reconvenes at 2:37 pm. Same appearances without Anissa Weier. Court states that during the break they received a question from the jury. Court received the question at 2:42 pm. and discusses the question with the parties. Court breaks to allow the Defense to speak with Anissa Weier.

Court reconvenes at 2:48 pm. Same appearances and with Anissa Weier, in custody. Court makes a decision to the question and returns the question back to the jurors at 2:51 pm. 

Jurors reached a verdict at 7:47 pm. 
 
Court reconvenes at 8:11 pm.  Same appearances with Anissa Weier, in custody. Jurors enter the courtroom. Court excuses the jurors from the courtroom at 8:13 pm. due to a concern with the verdict. Court discuss this issue with the parties and takes a short break.
 
Court reconvenes at 8:43 pm. Same appearances and with Anissa Weier, in custody. Court discusses further with the parties regarding the inconsistent verdict. Statements made by the State and Defense. Court rules that the verdict is inconsistent and the re-reads jury instructions.

Court reconvenes at 9:57 pm. Same appearances with Anissa Weier, in custody. Court received a question from the jurors at 9:53 pm. Court makes a copy of the question for the parties and discusses the question with the parties. Statements made by the Defense and State. Court makes a decision to the question and returns the question back to the jurors. 

Court reconvenes  at 10:12 pm. Same appearances with Anissa Weier, in custody. Court received a question from the jurors at 10:01 pm. Court makes a copy of the question for the parties and discuss with the parties. Statements by the Defense and State. Court makes a decision to the question and returns the question back to the jurors at 10:05 pm.

Court reconvenes at 10:32 pm. Same appearances with Anissa Weier, in custody. Court discusses with the parties regarding releasing the jurors for the evening and reconvening tomorrow. State requests that the Court ask the jurors if they want to continue to deliberate tonight or reconvene tomorrow at 9:00 am. Defense is in agreement. Court sends the question to the juror at 10:35 pm. 

Jurors reached a final verdict at 10:48 pm.

Court reconvenes at 10:52 pm. Same appearances with Anissa Weier, in custody. Jury enters the courtroom. The verdicts are published by the Court and read as follows: 
Question 1: At the time the crime was committed, did the defendant have a mental disease or defect? YES 
Question 2: As a result of the mental disease or defect, did the defendant lack substantial capacity either to appreciate the wrongfulness of the conduct or to conform that conduct to the requirements of law? YES 

Jurors polled by the Court. Jurors exit the courtroom. Defense moves for judgment on the verdict. Court grants the Defense request and enters judgment on the verdict. 
The Court orders the defendant committed to the Department of Health Services on today's date and orders the Department of Health Services to conduct a predisposition investigation and prepare a report to assist the court in framing a placement order under the commitment.  The report is to be furnished to the court no later than October 2, 2017. Upon receipt of the examiner's report, the Court will set a review hearing according to statute.

Defendant Anissa E Weier in court, in custody, with attorneys Joseph Smith and Maura Ann Mcmahon. Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz and Kevin Osborne appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court goes over some  preliminary instructions with the parties before the Jurors come down. No objections by the State or Defense.  Jurors arrive at 9:17am  Potential jurors sworn in for Voir Dire. Court gives preliminary jury instructions. Court conducts Voir Dire. Jurors #4083, #8554, #11038, #10551, #10272, #6990, #9204, #9261, #974, #7574, #8550, #1069, #2639, #6998, #3975, #3161, #1491, #778, #7577, and #3556 are stuck  for cause, Court announces next potential jurors. Jurors #1375, #2060, #7521, and #3586 are struck for cause, Court announces next potential jurors. Court takes short break at 10:47 am. 

Court reconvenes at 11:06 am. Same appearances, jurors present. Court continues with Voir Dire. Attorney Mcmahon requests to strike juror #2616. State objects. Court denies the request. Court breaks for lunch and excuses the jurors at 12:00 pm and to return at 1:30 pm. Court consults with the Attorneys regarding how to continue with Voir Dire. 

Court reconvenes at 1:33 pm. Same appearances. Continuing with Voir Dire. 
Court addresses issues with juror #1462 and #8543 for cause. Court strikes juror #1462 for cause and leaves juror #8543 to remain on the juror panel. Jurors enter the courtroom at 1:41 pm. Court continues with Voir Dire. Attorney Mcmahon requests juror #9033 be stricken. Court strikes juror #9033 for cause and announces next potential juror. 

The Jurors selected to try the issues and  sworn in are: #852, #5940, #7092, #8420, #9902, #10749, #5723, #1881, #6590, #4854, #7133, #3540, #8069, #4161, #8847, and #9694. Remaining jurors are released at 3:02 pm. Court takes short recess. 

Court reconvenes at 3:28 pm. Same appearances, without the jurors. Jurors enter the courtroom at 3:34 pm. Court discusses with the jurors a packet they received regarding sequestration for the length of the trial. Court swears in the bailiffs and the Court staff who will be watching over the jurors. Court gives preliminary instructions to the jurors again. Jurors are excused at 3:45 pm and are to return at 8:00 pm to the location the Sheriff will advise. Court will convene at 8:30 am tomorrow. Court authorizes Anissa Weier to be released to the Waukesha County Juvenile Detention Center until 6:00 pm.

Court breaks for the day at 4:13 pm
